Observable-Jupyter Documentation

Observable-Jupyter is a Python library that allows individuals to quickly create powerful yet simple interactive data visualizations.

Note

Never heard of Observable? Read the Relating Observable to Observable-Jupyter section to learn more.

Observable-Jupyter at a Glance

Why Observable-Jupyter?

Observable for the Python Community

Gives Python users access to Observable’s vast archives of community built data visualizations

Works without JavaScript

Although Observable uses JavaScript, JavaScript is not required for any of Observable-Jupyter’s “essential” functionality.

Configurable

Visualizations can be configured using Python.

Getting Started

Get started by checking out our most popular visualizations:

Popular Visualizations

Brushable ScatterPlot Matrix

World Choropleth Map

Barchart Race

Find More Visualizations on the Visualization Library section.
